NEWS: SpaceX says it is aiming to roll out its second-generation cellular @Starlink system in 2027, according to new FCC filing.

"SpaceXâ€™s first generation service is providing coverage to over 400 million people, with more than 6 million customers accessing the service each month. But this is only the beginning: SpaceX has also invested in spectrum that will enable it to launch a greatly enhanced second generation direct-to-device system in 2027."

tweets.text: RT @SERobinsonJr: STARLINK: Today, Prabhakar Jayakumar (@prabhakarpj), SpaceX's Head of Starlink India, and the Government of Goa signed aâ€¦

retweet.text:
STARLINK: Today, Prabhakar Jayakumar (@prabhakarpj), SpaceX's Head of Starlink India, and the Government of Goa signed a non-commercial Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to explore Starlink for digital inclusion, smart governance, disaster response, coastal safety, tourism, and public services in remote areas. 

The agreement, witnessed by Chief Minister Dr Pramod Sawant and IT Minister Rohan Khaunte, includes piloting the service to schools, healthcare facilities, and disaster centers.

More news in the EC below!

quoted.text:
Let me get this straight:

> there's a loophole in the Constitutional definition of a census that counts *all residents* 

> this includes 15m+ illegal immigrants

> therefore states and counties with large populations of illegal immigrants get greater representation in Congress?!

Regardless of which states or counties this benefits, this is *NOT* an acceptable loophole in the democratic process

Table stakes move is to ensure that the Census only counts citizens. 

The Founding Fathers were brilliant but they didn't anticipate a world in which the population of illegal immigrants (15-30m) would be 5x greater than the entire population of America (3m) at the time when the Constitution was written
